result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Habermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with all Family Court and Child Support orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L Habermann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on July 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery in court.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense has no explanation as to why deft is not here. Ms. Delery has not had contact with deft. The State has checked to see if deft was in custody in Milwaukee or Kenosha and he is not. State asks for BW/BF

BTC: BW/BF

Hearing is continued. 
Defendant Christopher L Habermann in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Defendant appeared late. Upon plea to 15CF1434, State recommends 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES/STAYED - probation. 15CF310 previously plead to
P-G
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: BW/BF is vacated. guilty as above. PSI ordered

Defendant Christopher L Habermann in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Christopher L Habermann in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Christopher L Habermann in court with attorney Sheila M. Smith.  Defendant Christopher L Habermann in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
